attributes.description: Copper is mined in open pits and below ground. The ore usually contains less than 1% copper. The ore is ground, concentrated, and slurried with water and chemical reagents. Air blown through the mixture attaches to the copper, causing it to float to the top of the slurry. The copper is then removed with a skimmer. After this happens the copper is dried, making the slurry into a dry powder. This powder is then fed into a furnace, the impurities and the copper melt, and the two are segregated. With the copper floating to the bottom and the slag, or impurities, floating to the top where they are taken out. After this the copper and other heavy impurities are put into a converter, where air, lime, and silica are added to react with iron. Here the iron is the slag and is extracted to be recycled. The final step is fire refining, air and natural gas is blown through the copper, to remove any remaining sulfar and oxygen. Then the copper is cast into copper anodes and charged, leaving 99% cp.
attributes.title: Copper
Polyurethane
attributes.description: Oil is shipped to a processing plant where the oil is broken down and then mixed with a variety of additives, polyalcohals, and catalysts to create polyurethane. It is then shipped to California

attributes.title: Steel
attributes.description: Steel is made by combining iron and other alloy additives. First steel is mined, then the ore is melted down and is purified by using flux. Flux almost sucks up all of the metals impurities out of a molten ore and can be multiple things. The most economical choice for flux is wood shavings. The type of alloy that is added to the iron can change the steels performance in terms of hardness, ductility, and tensile strength. The most commonly used alloy is carbon, when used to create Steel its presence is usually 0.2% to 2.1% by weight. This percentage varies depending on the grade of steel. After the alloy is added, the molten ore is poured into a simple mold where it is allowed to cool. From here it is transported a port to be shipped.

attributes.title: U.S. Main port
attributes.description: This port receives aver 400 million tons of trade and resources each year. It recieves all of the necessary materials to build and oil rig, then has drivers to ship the piping to Canada

attributes.title: Titanium
attributes.description: Titanium is a metal that has high corrosion resistance, a good weight to strength ratio, and high heat resistance. Titanium is never found in its pure form, it is usually found in three ores, ilmenite, leucoxene, and rutile. Ilmenite and leucoxene are two ores of similar composition, however ilmenite contains about 53% titanium oxide and leucoxene contains about 90% titanium oxide. How titanium is extracted is through the Kroll process, which involves extraction, purification, and then producing a sponge. When a sponge is made titanium is made into a block with magnesium and magnesium chloride. To remove these impurities it is then treated with water and hydrochloric acid, which takes the impurities out and leaves the block looking like a sponge.

attributes.title: Australia's Main Port
attributes.description: The titanium reaches the port, where it is shipped to Lousiana

attributes.title: Polyurethane wheels
attributes.description: Polyurethane is molded and cooled/dried to allow for a wheel shape to be held. Logos are then added and the wheels are shipped to Denver

attributes.title: Consumer
attributes.description: The wheels are sent to Denver to be sold to the consumer who then uses it for recreational purposes

attributes.title: Port Of Santiago
attributes.address: Comodoro Arturo Merino Benítez International Airport (SCL), Pudahuel, Santiago Metropolitan Region, Chile

attributes.title: aluminum
attributes.description: Aluminum is a metal that is extremely easy to find, it is the 3rd most found element on the earth. However extracting it is extremely difficult as it requires the melting of electrolytes and then having carbon electrodes passing their natural electrical current through them. As aluminum requires electricity to complete the entire process, about 15 kilowatts of electricity is used to produce about 2 pounds of aluminum.

attributes.title: Chinas Main Port to U.S. Main port
Australia's Main Port to U.S. Main port

attributes.description: The wheels are sent to Denver to be sold and then used by the consumers
attributes.title: Polyurethane wheels to Consumer
